lines.text: I am sitting here, Mr. Cook, toying with the idea of removing your heart... and stuffing it like an olive!
I'll tell you briefly what I think of newspaper men. The hand of God, reaching down into the mire, couldn't elevate one of them to the depths of degradation!
For good clean fun, there's nothing like a wake.
Oh please, let's not talk shop.
It's kind of startling to be brought to life twice - and each time in Warsaw!
Listen, my dying swan, this is no time to stop faking! You're gonna have pneumonia and you're gonna have it good!

[introducing on stage performer on horseback]
Katinka who saved Holland by putting her finger in the dyke. Show them the finger babe.
[extends bandaged middle finger to audience]
You've lived here all your life?
Twice that long.
that Oliver Stone is worse than radium poisoning four ways from the jack!
Pneumonia... It's the finger of God if it's true.
You mean to say you stood there and let me beat a defenseless woman?
I did, Mr. Cook.
Where's your sense of chivalry?
My chivalry? Aren't you just a trifle confused, Mr. Cook? You hit her!
That's entirely different! I love her!
[last lines]
Hazel! Hazel!
Yes, Enoch? What is it?
Hazel! Hazel! Run for your life! Run for your life! The hotel is flooded!

[Speaking to Wally Cook]
You're a newspaperman. I can smell 'em. I've always been able to smell 'em. Excuse me while I open the window?
I got in touch with Oliver, er, Oliver Stone my editor. He's toe dancing in the street waiting for us.
I hope he's nice like you.
Well he's got a different quality of charm. He's sort of a cross between a ferris wheel and a werewolf. But with a lovable streak if you care to blast for it.
How do you feel, sailor?
Hunky-dory, skipper.

[suffering from a hangover]
Oh my gosh, there's a sawmill inside my head.

[after Hazel kisses him several times]
The biggest fire since Rome!
